content:
• Thursday, August 4, 2011
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) fell 2.8% AH after reporting Q2 results. Gross margin declined to...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR) fell 2.8% AH after reporting Q2 results. Gross margin declined to 36.6% from 48.3% in Q2 2010, as lower sales and price pressure took their toll. The company now expects 2011 revenue of $3.6B-$3.7B and EPS of $9.00-$9.50, compared with a consensus of $3.75B and $9.24. Free cash flow is expected to be negative. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 PM | 4 Comments
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD) rose 4.9% AH in response to the company's Q2 results. Members grew 61% Y/Y to...

    LinkedIn (LNKD) rose 4.9% AH in response to the company's Q2 results. Members grew 61% Y/Y to 115.8M, and unique visitors were up 83%. The Hiring Solutions business grew 170% Y/Y, and now accounts for 48% of revenue. 2011 revenue guidance of $475M-$485M is above the $467.7M consensus. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 PM
  • ED

    Consolidated Edison (NYSE:ED): EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.04. Profits of (-9.8% Y/Y) Company sees...

    Consolidated Edison (NYSE:ED): EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.04. Profits of (-9.8% Y/Y) Company sees FY11 EPS $3.45 - $3.65 vs. consensus of $3.55. Shares +1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM
  • FLR

    More on Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q2 beats estimates as profit was boosted by expansion of projects in...

    More on Fluor (NYSE:FLR): Q2 beats estimates as profit was boosted by expansion of projects in the mining and metals sectors. Its project backlog soars to a record $40.3B. Separately, Saudi Aramco and Dow Chemical (DOW) awarded the company a contract for all utilities and offsites at the massive al-Jubail chemical complex in Saudi Arabia. Shares +7.1% AH.Â 

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • PBI

    Pitney Bowes (NYSE:PBI): Q2 EPS of $0.52 in-line. Revenue of $1.31B (+1.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    Pitney Bowes (NYSE:PBI): Q2 EPS of $0.52 in-line. Revenue of $1.31B (+1.3% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +0.1% AH. Sees FY11 FCF at $750M-$850M, Non-GAAP EPS of $2.15-$2.35, GAAP EPS of $1.80-$2.10. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • FLR

    Fluor (NYSE:FLR): EPS of $0.94 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $6.03B (+17% Y/Y) beats by $240M....

    Fluor (NYSE:FLR): EPS of $0.94 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $6.03B (+17% Y/Y) beats by $240M. Shares +7.1% AH. (PR). The company raises FY11 EPS guidance to $3.10 to $ 3.40 per share from its previous range of $3.00 to $3.40.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • CF

    CF Industries (NYSE:CF): Q2 EPS of $6.75 beats by $0.88. Revenue of $1.8B (+38% Y/Y) beats by...

    CF Industries (NYSE:CF): Q2 EPS of $6.75 beats by $0.88. Revenue of $1.8B (+38% Y/Y) beats by $40M. Approves $1.5B share repurchasement plan. Sees strong demand and tight inventories in 2012 supporting crop prices. Shares +5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): EPS of $0.70 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $532.8M (-9% Y/Y) misses by...

    First Solar (NASDAQ:FSLR): EPS of $0.70 misses by $0.22. Revenue of $532.8M (-9% Y/Y) misses by 48.2M. Shares -3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • MCHP

    Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $374M (+5% Y/Y)...

    Microchip Technology (NASDAQ:MCHP): FQ1 EPS of $0.55 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $374M (+5% Y/Y) in-line. Sees 2QFY11 Revenue at $352M-$370.8M, GAAP EPS at $0.44-$0.48, Non-GAAP EPS at $0.50-$0.54. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM | 1 Comment
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (HIG -6.3%) took a hit today as Q2 core profit fell 68% on higher disaster...

    Hartford Financial (HIG -6.3%) took a hit today as Q2 core profit fell 68% on higher disaster and asbestos claim costs. The company also reduced FY11 guidance and announced a $500M stock buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn ((LNKD): Q2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $121M beats by $16M. Shares +4.9%...

    LinkedIn ((LNKD): Q2 EPS of $0.10 beats by $0.13. Revenue of $121M beats by $16M. Shares +4.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • DNDN

    Dendreon (DNDN -67.4%) takes down an entire industry, with the Amex Biotech index falling an...

    Dendreon (DNDN -67.4%) takes down an entire industry, with the Amex Biotech index falling an astonishing 10.4%. "Biotech risk takers burned on this one might be less risk tolerant going forward," one analyst explains. "The biotech group does work like that, especially for product failures." IBB -7.9%. XBI -9.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • NSIT

    Insight Enterprises (NSIT +9.6%) is up today after its Q2 results beat expectations, as sales in...

    Insight Enterprises (NSIT +9.6%) is up today after its Q2 results beat expectations, as sales in all product groups jumped Y/Y. The company also ups Q3 guidance, saying its revenues are already "ahead of plan."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (HMA -7.7%) trades at its lows after saying it's been subpoenaed by...

    Health Management Associates (HMA -7.7%) trades at its lows after saying it's been subpoenaed by the Department of Health and Human Services. One subpoena requests information on physician referrals, and the other on the company's emergency room management operations and its use of Pro-Med patient management software.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • OI

    Owens-Illinois (OI -4.7%) is down after Standard & Poor's lowered its outlook on the company...

    Owens-Illinois (OI -4.7%) is down after Standard & Poor's lowered its outlook on the company late yesterday, saying higher costs and weak demand continue to pressure earnings.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • WLT

    Coal stocks (KOL -8.6%) get taken to the woodshed after a rash of disappointing earnings reports...

    Coal stocks (KOL -8.6%) get taken to the woodshed after a rash of disappointing earnings reports and worries on energy demand. Walter Energy (WLT -29.5%) dramatically leads the pack downward, but holders of L&L Energy (LLE -14.8%), Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -16%) and Consol Energy (CNX -11.3%) get hit hard as well.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM | 2 Comments
  • FIRE

    Sourcefire (FIRE +7.9%) sits as a rare stock showing a healthy gain today after beating...

    Sourcefire (FIRE +7.9%) sits as a rare stock showing a healthy gain today after beating estimates on Q2 earnings, and receiving a slew of analyst upgrades. Barclays Capital upgraded shares to Equal Weight, and increased its price target to $24 from $22. UBS moved their rating to Buy from Neutral with a lofty $32 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM
  • ATSG

    Air Transport Services (ATSG +19%) jumps after beating Q2 expectations, as an increase in...

    Air Transport Services (ATSG +19%) jumps after beating Q2 expectations, as an increase in aircraft deployment contributed to improved cash flow and profitability for the quarter. However, much of today's strength is likely due to short covering. The stock is off 46% this year, and was heavily shorted going into yesterday's earnings report.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P +3.1%) is still positive thanks to Merrill Lynch's Nat Schindler launching coverage...

    Pandora (P +3.1%) is still positive thanks to Merrill Lynch's Nat Schindler launching coverage with a Buy rating and $17 PT. With 60% of Pandora listening now on mobile devices, Schindler sees the company as a play on mobile Internet growth, and believes revenues will surge as it streams more audio ads.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • GOOG

    Motorola Mobility (MMI +2.7%) is up on an ugly day after announcing the XT531, a low-cost...

    Motorola Mobility (MMI +2.7%) is up on an ugly day after announcing the XT531, a low-cost Android phone aimed at China and other international markets. Motorola has struggled to keep pace with Android rivals Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) and HTC (OTC:HTCCF) as of late, but China has been a bright spot for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • ASGN

    Staffing firm On Assignment (ASGN +1%) has given back most of the days gains, after a +9% jump...

    Staffing firm On Assignment (ASGN +1%) has given back most of the days gains, after a +9% jump at the opening bell on better Q2 earnings gets lost in today's market weakness. The company easily beat estimates and bumped up Q3 guidance, saying it sees itself " comfortably ahead" of where it needs to be in terms of growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • STRI

    Solar encapsulant maker STR Holdings (NYSE:STRI) is down 19.8% after reporting revenue of...

    Solar encapsulant maker STR Holdings (NYSE:STRI) is down 19.8% after reporting revenue of $102.4M and non-GAAP EPS of $0.30, compared with a consensus of $98.3M and $0.31. Solar shipments fell 13.5% Q/Q due to European weakness. STR expects 2011 revenue of $381M-$398M and non-GAAP EPS of $1.12-$1.22, below a consensus of $425.5M and $1.42.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • EMKR

    Communications and solar chip vendor EMCORE (NASDAQ:EMKR) falls 32.4% after reporting FQ3...

    Communications and solar chip vendor EMCORE (NASDAQ:EMKR) falls 32.4% after reporting FQ3 revenue of $49.5M (+6% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.12, below a consensus of $49.8M and -$0.04. Gross margin fell 3.3% Q/Q to 22.4%, but order backlog grew 31% Q/Q. The company expects FQ4 revenue of $51M-$55M, in-line with a $53.7M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • CAR

    Zipcar (ZIP +4.7%) is one of the days few gainers after its Q2 EPS easily beat estimates on a...

    Zipcar (ZIP +4.7%) is one of the days few gainers after its Q2 EPS easily beat estimates on a jump in memberships. The company posted fewer losses with higher revenues, and ups guidance for Q3 and FY11.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • TLT

    The plummet in Treasury yields has brought the 10 year all the way down to 2.47%. Sound...

    The plummet in Treasury yields has brought the 10 year all the way down to 2.47%. Sound familiar? That's the yield it was at when Ben Bernanke unleashed the idea of QEII at Jackson Hole last August. Quite a round trip since then. The Fed meets on Tuesday. TLT +9% in a week.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • USO

    As stocks return to their lows of the session, WTI crude starts moving down in big chunks, now...

    As stocks return to their lows of the session, WTI crude starts moving down in big chunks, now threatening $86/barrel. USO -5.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM | 2 Comments
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley's (MS -3.3%) CEO James Gorman became the first company insider in two years to...

    Morgan Stanley's (MS -3.3%) CEO James Gorman became the first company insider in two years to purchase shares with his $2.1M buy today into market weakness. On the flip side, insiders at the firm have sold $46M of shares in the past year alone.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • HGG

    Electronics store chain hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) loses 12.6% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $431.5M...

    Electronics store chain hhgregg (NYSE:HGG) loses 12.6% after reporting FQ1 revenue of $431.5M (-1% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.02, below a consensus of $478.1M and $0.01. Same-store sales fell 13.2%. William Blair had previously singled out hhgregg as being particularly at risk of losing market share to Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN). Rival BBY is down 5.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • PMIR

    Shares of PMI Group (PMI -55.1%) crater after the mortgage insurer says it may have to stop...

    Shares of PMI Group (PMI -55.1%) crater after the mortgage insurer says it may have to stop selling new coverage policies, and a backup plan has "no assurance" of succeeding. Rival firms MGIC Investment (MTG -16.5%), Radian Group (RDN -16.2%) and Genworth (GNW -6.6%) also suffer in deep sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    As Clearwire (CLWR -18.7%) plunges following Q2 results, with cash burn and the...

    As Clearwire (CLWR -18.7%) plunges following Q2 results, with cash burn and the Sprint-Lightsquared deal bringing its viability into question, some analysts remain bullish. Citadel is confident Clearwire will get the funding it needs for its LTE network build, and Wells Fargo thinks going with LTE opens the door to new partnerships. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • DVA

    One of just 4 S&P 500 stocks solidly green today is dialysis services provider DaVita (DVA...

    One of just 4 S&P 500 stocks solidly green today is dialysis services provider DaVita (DVA +2.3%). The company earned $1.17/share in Q2 against estimates for $1.14 thanks to a bump in operating margins. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • RDS.A

    Shares of big oil companies sink even further than the broad market, as the sector closes in on...

    Shares of big oil companies sink even further than the broad market, as the sector closes in on a 10th consecutive losing session. Global economic woes weigh heavy on the prospect for oil demand. Losers: Royal Dutch Shell (RDS.A -4.7%), Petrobas (PBR -7.2%), Marathon Oil (MRO -5.3%), Valero Energy (VLO -6.4%), Chevron (CVX -4.3%), BP (BP -4.1%).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • GTIV

    Health services provider Gentiva (NASDAQ:GTIV), which had already fallen this week on fears of...

    Health services provider Gentiva (NASDAQ:GTIV), which had already fallen this week on fears of Medicare cuts, is down 31.4% today after reporting Q2 revenue of $456.9M and adjusted EPS of $0.49, below a consensus of $466.2M and $0.65. 2011 revenue and EPS guidance of $1.8B-$1.85B and $2.00-$2.20 is below a consensus of $1.88B and $2.68.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • CIR

    Industrial components maker CIRCOR (NYSE:CIR) falls 20.8% after reporting Q2 revenue of $191.9M...

    Industrial components maker CIRCOR (NYSE:CIR) falls 20.8% after reporting Q2 revenue of $191.9M (+14% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.43, below a consensus of $205.8M and $0.50. The shortfall is blamed on "shipping delays in a few large projects." CIRCOR expects Q3 revenue of $202M-$212M and EPS of $0.47-$0.57, below a consensus of $216.1M and $0.63.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM

  • MercadoLibre (MELI-8%) trades lower after reporting a mixed Q2. Revenue came in at $69M, in line...

    MercadoLibre (MELI-8%) trades lower after reporting a mixed Q2. Revenue came in at $69M, in line with the Street, but EPS missed at $0.34 versus $0.38 per share. Sales gained 32% Y/Y, but margins were negatively impacted by the pre-sale of credit card receivables from last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • USO

    Accelerating its decline, WTI crude drops below $89/barrel to $88.15, beginning to fill a...

    Accelerating its decline, WTI crude drops below $89/barrel to $88.15, beginning to fill a gap on the charts back to February, when hostilities broke out in Libya. The YTD low on oil is about $84. USO -4.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 2 Comments
  • SCOR

    Online-data researcher comScore (SCOR -29%) plunges after its Q2 swings to a loss on one-time...

    Online-data researcher comScore (SCOR -29%) plunges after its Q2 swings to a loss on one-time charges, plus cyclical changes to customer inventories that culminated in reduced sales. The company also cuts its FY11 forecast and reduces top-line sales estimates due to ongoing economic weakness.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • THS

    Shares of Treehouse Foods (THS +3.9%) push higher after the firm reports Q2 EPS in-line, and...

    Shares of Treehouse Foods (THS +3.9%) push higher after the firm reports Q2 EPS in-line, and affirms guidance for FY11. CEO Sam Reed says, "we believe we have recovered the significant portion of our margin shortfall resulting from input costs and transportation." PR

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • WLT

    Shares of Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) can't manage to stop their freefall after a Q2 earnings...

    Shares of Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) can't manage to stop their freefall after a Q2 earnings disaster, and are now down 24.8%. BMO's Meredith Brandy calls the earnings result "horrible," but keeps her Outperform rating in place on valuation and takeover potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • NTSP

    Debit card vendor NetSpend (NASDAQ:NTSP) is down 33.9% after reporting Q2 revenue of $74.4M...

    Debit card vendor NetSpend (NASDAQ:NTSP) is down 33.9% after reporting Q2 revenue of $74.4M (+10% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.11, compared with a consensus of $78.6M and $0.11. The company expects 2011 revenue of $306M-$314M adjusted EPS of $0.44-$0.48, compared with a consensus of $326M and $0.45. Wedbush is downgrading NetSpend today.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • SVNTQ

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -25%) gets hammered after its Q2 results widely missed analysts'...

    Savient Pharmaceuticals (SVNT -25%) gets hammered after its Q2 results widely missed analysts' projections, as higher R&D, marketing and administrative expenses weighed on margins. Revenues were also down due to disappointing rollout sales of its new gout drug KRYSTEXXA.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • EDMC

    Shares of Education Management (EDMC +4.4%) move up sharply after the firm beats estimates by a...

    Shares of Education Management (EDMC +4.4%) move up sharply after the firm beats estimates by a penny, and raises guidance for FY12 EPS to $1.49-$1.57. Morgan Stanley maintains an Underweight rating on shares with a $16 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • CTB

    Cooper Tire & Rubber (NYSE:CTB) drops 29.2% after reporting Q2 revenue of $922M (+15% Y/Y)...

    Cooper Tire & Rubber (NYSE:CTB) drops 29.2% after reporting Q2 revenue of $922M (+15% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.18, well below a consensus of $979.9M and $0.41. The company blames the shortfall on weak consumer demand and high raw material prices, and says it will "likely" reduce its goal of increasing tire production by 10% in 2011. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • BK

    A rush into T-bills gets heavier as Bank of New York (BK -2.5%) - the world's biggest custodian...

    A rush into T-bills gets heavier as Bank of New York (BK -2.5%) - the world's biggest custodian bank - starts charging a 13-basis point fee for huge cash deposits. With even more cash headed out in search of a home, three-month T-bills sit at 0.005%, and one-month bills turned negative this morning.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • ANF

    Shares of Ambercrombie & Fitch (ANF +2.5%) led the pack of retailers reporting strong July...

    Shares of Ambercrombie & Fitch (ANF +2.5%) led the pack of retailers reporting strong July sales today (I, II, III), beating estimates along with Limited Brands (LTD -1.5%) and Macy's (M -3.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM
  • SRDX

    SurModics (SRDX +21%) shares soar after FQ3 results beat estimates late yesterday. The company's...

    SurModics (SRDX +21%) shares soar after FQ3 results beat estimates late yesterday. The company's focus on its core business and managing execution costs boosted margins, while top-line sales were helped by five new license agreements in its Medical Device business.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • ARO

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) falls 19.9%, reaching a new 52-week low, after the company announces Q2...

    Aeropostale (NYSE:ARO) falls 19.9%, reaching a new 52-week low, after the company announces Q2 sales declined 5% Y/Y to $468.2M (below a $490.9M consensus), and same-store sales fell 14%. Aeropostale blames the shortfall on "a lack of balance" to merchandise assortments, and "continued promotional and macroeconomic challenges."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 1 Comment
  • CBOU

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (CBOU +0.8%) recover after an intra-day slide yesterday on the strength...

    Shares of Caribou Coffee (CBOU +0.8%) recover after an intra-day slide yesterday on the strength of an earnings beat last night of $0.13 vs $0.09 consensus, and after the firm issues upward guidance with a stronger sale forecast. Revised FY11 guidance: Net sales to 11%-13%, from 7%-9%. EPS to $0.39-$0.41, from $0.35-$0.37.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • SWI

    IT systems management software vendor SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI) gains 10.5% after reporting revenue...

    IT systems management software vendor SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI) gains 10.5% after reporting revenue of $45.8M (+29% Y/Y) and non-GAAP EPS of $0.22, beating a consensus of $44.3M and $0.20. The company expects 2011 revenue of $191.5M-$196M and non-GAAP EPS of $0.86-$0.90, compared with a consensus of $188.4M and $0.88. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM
  • EDS

    The Exceed (EDS -10.5%) fraud accusations are just another black-eye to Nasdaq's due diligence...

    The Exceed (EDS -10.5%) fraud accusations are just another black-eye to Nasdaq's due diligence of its China IPO's. The report by D.B. Research alleges the Chinese sports apparel retailer listed on the Nasdaq only after earlier being forced to pull its IPO in Hong Kong due to accusations of "rampant fraud."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:55 AM
  • LUV

    Investors sour on Southwest's (LUV -6.8%) relatively good Q2 performance, driving shares lower...

    Investors sour on Southwest's (LUV -6.8%) relatively good Q2 performance, driving shares lower on the disclosure the firm will sideline airplanes to counter high fuel costs. Other airline stocks falling sharply in sympathy: UAL -4.4%, TAM -5.8%, AMR -5.1%, DAL -4.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • EDS

    Exceed (EDS -10%) pares back some its early losses after the company issues a statement...

    Exceed (EDS -10%) pares back some its early losses after the company issues a statement defending its financial operations. In a letter to shareholders, CEO Shuipan Lin says the company maintains "a high level of transparency and disclosure, and our financial position and operations remain strong."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • S

    Stifel Nicholas is upgrading Sprint (NYSE:S) to Hold: while still "cautious" on the company due...

    Stifel Nicholas is upgrading Sprint (NYSE:S) to Hold: while still "cautious" on the company due to a weak Q2 and competitive pressures, the firm thinks the recent selloff in Sprint shares limits future downside. Sprint is nonetheless down 5.3% today, as shares fall in sympathy with those of 4G partner Clearwire (CLWR -27.1%). (more on CLWR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • LYG

    U.K. bank shares join Lloyd's (LYG -11.4%) in a sharp drop following the lender's earnings...

    U.K. bank shares join Lloyd's (LYG -11.4%) in a sharp drop following the lender's earnings report. Citi notes impairments on Lloyd's real estate portfolio came in worse than expected and says concerns remain about its leveraged loan book, which remains vulnerable to a weakening economy. RBS -8.1%, BCS -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • GOLD

    Randgold (GOLD +8.2%) pops as Q2 profits jump to a record $128M on higher output as well as the...

    Randgold (GOLD +8.2%) pops as Q2 profits jump to a record $128M on higher output as well as the sale of stockpiled gold from its new Ivory Coast Tongon mine. Production rose 97% Y/Y to 184,711 ounces. The company reafirms its FY11 guidance, saying new mines are on track to boost gold production by more than 70%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • EM

    Emdeon (EM +13.9%), whose shares popped yesterday on a report the company will be acquired by...

    Emdeon (EM +13.9%), whose shares popped yesterday on a report the company will be acquired by Blackstone (BX -6.2%), announces today the deal will be going through at a price of $19/share, paid entirely in cash. Banc of America, Merrill Lynch, Barclays, and Citigroup will provide financing for the deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • TDC

    Shares of Terdata (TDC +5.8%) soar after the firm booked a 24% increase in revenue from last...

    Shares of Terdata (TDC +5.8%) soar after the firm booked a 24% increase in revenue from last year and raised its guidance for FY11. The firm now sees revenue growth of 18%-20%, and EPS of $2.20-$2.28. For good measure, the firm also anticipates it will benefit from currency fluctuations. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT -17.4%) Q2 earnings came in below estimates, as margins were hit by...

    Walter Energy (WLT -17.4%) Q2 earnings came in below estimates, as margins were hit by acquisition-related costs and slumping coal volumes. Worsening matters, the company has cut back on the amount of information it provides in its financial reports, making it difficult to determine the exact cause of the quarter's miss.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM | 2 Comments
  • T

    More on DirecTV's (NYSE:DTV) Q2: Free cash flow +3% Y/Y to $395M. U.S. division sees 26K net...

    More on DirecTV's (NYSE:DTV) Q2: Free cash flow +3% Y/Y to $395M. U.S. division sees 26K net subscriber additions; churn increases to 1.59%, and average revenue per user (ARPU) increases $1.59 Q/Q to $90.58. Latin American division sees 472K net adds; churn decreases to 1.81%, and ARPU increases $2.87 to $64.56. DTV -5.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:32 AM
